On Sun, 7 Nov 2004 20:05:47 -0800, John Arrowwood <jarrowwx@...> wrote:
> I'm assuming that all 30 are the same throughout the evolution run.
> If that isn't the case, then that changes things...

No, they're randomized each generation.
 
> One thing you could *try* is start with a small training/evaluation
> set (like you have), and when the population plateaus, add another one
> (or one of each shape), but without restarting the experiment.  Repeat
> until you get a champion that consistently gets 100% on the 100 test
> samples. 

Well, that's similar to what we're trying.  We evolve a population
where there's an indivudal that gets 100% on a small evaluation
set...then we halve the population and double the evaluation set. 
We've tried it a bit this weekend, and it does seem to be working
reasonably well.

Derek
